pages.title: Beacon Harness
pages.text: The <item>Beacon Harness/$ is a powerful <thing>$(l:essentials:intro/beam)beam/$ source, which produces <thing>$(l:essentials:intro/beam)power/$ 512 <thing>$(l:essentials:intro/beam)beams/$ of varying colors. It also produces <thing>$(l:essentials:intro/technomancy)temporal entropy/$ as a byproduct.$(br2)In order to work, the <item>beacon harness/$ must be placed <em>under/$ a beacon, with no air gap. It does not need to be touching

the beacon block itself- it can be under the beacon base, and it will not interfere with the beacon running. It can also share the beacon with an <item>$(l:essentials:technomancy/sink)entropy sink/$.$(br2)While running, the <item>beacon harness/$ will produce a beam of <thing>$(l:essentials:intro/beam)power/$ 512- however, the color of the beam will continuously change in a simple pattern. If you look at a <item>$(l:essentials:beam/chart)color chart/$, the

color produced will follow the sequence of colors on the outer rim of the <item>$(l:essentials:beam/chart)color chart/$, starting at red (pure $(l:essentials:beam/energy)energy/$) rotating clockwise (towards green). The time to make one full loop is 24 seconds (120 <thing>$(l:essentials:intro/beam)cycles/$).$(br2)This means that while running, the <item>beacon harness/$ will produce a mix of 2 <thing>$(l:essentials:intro/beam)primary alignments/$ (2 of <thing>$(l:essentials:beam/energy)energy/$, <thing>$(l:essentials:beam/potential)potential/$, and <thing>$(l:essentials:beam/stability)stability

<thing>$(l:essentials:beam/stability)/$). In order to run, the <item>beacon harness/$ <em>must be supplied with the <thing>$(l:essentials:intro/beam)alignment/$<em> it isn't producing/$ (<thing>$(l:essentials:intro/beam)power/$ doesn't matter). Giving it a mixed beam will shut it down. This means that while producing a mix of <thing>$(l:essentials:beam/energy)energy/$ and <thing>$(l:essentials:beam/energy)potential/$, you must supply a beam of pure <thing>$(l:essentials:beam/stability)stability/$. There is a <em>grace period/$ where you can supply the <item>beacon harness/$ with anything- or nothing- without it shutting down.

This grace period lasts 1.6 seconds (8 cycles) every time the required incoming <thing>$(l:essentials:intro/beam)beam/$ changes. Use this grace period as the switchover time for automated systems.$(br2)While running, the <item>beacon harness/$ produces 1 <thing>$(l:essentials:intro/technomancy)temporal entropy/$ per tick.$(br2)The <item>beacon harness/$ is started (turned on) with a redstone signal
(this can be a pulse). It takes 2 seconds (10 <thing>$(l:essentials:intro/beam)cycles/$) to startup.$(br2)
